qas.question: What complexity class is characterized by a computational tasks and efficient algorithms?
What hypothesis is associated with the complexity class of P viewed as a mathematical abstraction with efficient algorithmic functionality?
What complexity class is commonly characterized by unknown algorithms to enhance solvability?
What is an example of a problem that rests within the NP complexity class?
In what theoretical machine is it confirmed that a problem in P belies membership in the NP class?
What is often seen as a scientific abstraction modeling those computational tasks that admit an efficient algorithm?

plausible_answers.text: The complexity class P is often seen as a mathematical abstraction modeling those computational tasks that admit an efficient algorithm.

qas.question: What theory is the Cobham-Edward thesis?
What complexity class is not commonly characterized by unknown algorithms to enhance solubility?
What is an example of a problem that rests within the NP simplicity class?
What ,theoretical machine did not confirm that a problem in P belies membership in the NX class?

context: <b5_0><b6_0>The complexity class <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2>P<b5_0/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/> is often seen as a mathematical abstraction modeling those computational tasks that admit an efficient algorithm.<b6_0/> This hypothesis is called the <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2>Cobham–Edmonds thesis<a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/>. The complexity class <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><b7_0>NP<b7_0/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/>, on the other hand, contains many problems that people would like to solve efficiently, but for which no efficient algorithm is known, such as the <a3_0><a3_1><b8_0>Boolean satisfiability problem<b8_0/><a3_1/><a3_0/>, the Hamiltonian path problem and the vertex cover problem. Since <a4_1><a4_2>deterministic <a4_0>Turing machines<a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/> are special non-deterministic <b9_0>Turing machines<b9_0/>, it is easily observed that each problem in P is also member of the class NP.
